One in three women in Vietnam suffers from domestic violence. Domestic violence can happen to anybody in any place and under different circumstances.

Have you ever wondered why some women decide to keep silent and endure violent acts from their husbands, which sometimes can be dangerous to life? Why do they not dare stand up for themselves instead of accepting physical and mental injuries for a long period of time? The exhibition "Behind Closed Doors" will give you truthful answers through personal stories of many victims who have suffered domestic violence.

The exhibition "Behind Closed Doors" is open from November 23rd 2018. This is an activity within the framework of the project titled "Educating and advocating Vietnamese women in addressing social issues related to women in the period of 2017 - 2027". With the message "Speak Out," it encourages victims of domestic violence and the community to break the silence and help eradicate domestic violence in different cases. The exhibition also shares some efforts of the Peace House and other reliable shelters for women of the Vietnamese Women's Union in addressing the issue nationwide.
